cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS TEE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)S. E 0 RvE Tri..?, 266 (22).OA 33 I JET,:' HOME AFFAIRS "COMMITTEE. EXPIRING LAWS CONTINUANCE Bill-Note by the Financial Secretary to the Treasury.- '/ - : The annexed draft Bill is circulated.^ for consideration at the meeting the^Eome Affairs Committoe on Jfcnday next, J-ane 25th,, 1923^ at 4,3^p.my' No formal decision of the Cabinet has:yet been-taken as to the continuance for a further year from 8tfr: Sejtember^p next of the., power of the Board of Trade to give guarantees w in respect of exports under the Overseas Trade (Credit and Insurance) Act 1920 which has been included provisionally in Part IV of the Schedule.There is also under consideration by the Treasury the question of the continuance for a further year, from 10th -November next of the power of the Treasury to guarantee . loans under the Trade Facilities Act which would involve an addition to the Schedule of the Trade Facilities and . Loans, Guarantee Act 1922, Section (X) Sub-Section (2).(Signed ) CT. JOYNSON-HICKS..Treasury Chambers, June 23rd, 1923. [13 & 14 Geo. 5.] Expiring Laws Continuance.1DRAFT' i OF AB ILLTo continue certain expiring laws.Til 7 HERE AS the Acts mentioned in the Schedule to Y.V this Act are, in so far as they are in force and are temporary in their duration, limited to expire as respects the Acts mentioned in Parts I., II., and III. of that 5 Schedule on the thirty-first day of December, nineteen hundred and twenty-three, the thirty-first day of March, nineteen hundred and twenty-four, and the thirty-first day of August, nineteen hundred and twenty-four, respectively, and as respects the Act mentioned in Part IV. of that 10 Schedule on the eighth day of September, nineteen hundred and twenty-three, and as respects the Acts mentioned in Part V. of that Schedule on the thirty-first day of March, nineteen hundred and twenty-four :And whereas it is expedient to provide for the con-15 tinuance as in this A.ct mentioned of those Acts and of the enactments amending or affecting the same:Be it therefore enacted hy the K"ing's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present' 20 Parliament assembled, and hy the authority of the same, as follows: 1. (l) The Acts mentioned in Parts I., II. and Continuance. III. of the Schedule to this Act shall, to the extent of Acts in specified in column three of that Schedule, be continued ie u e-25 until the thirty-first day of December, nineteen hundred and twenty-four, and shall then expire, unless further continued.. "81-2 A. 2Expiring. Lg,ws Continuance,, [13 fell Geo;,5;]A.D. 1923. (2) The Act mentioned in Part IV. of the Schedule to this Act shall, to the extent specified in column three of that Schedule, be continued until the eighth day of September, nineteen hundred and twenty-four, and shall then expire, unless further continued. &(3.) The Acts mentioned in Part V. of the Schedule to this Act shall, to the extent specified in column three of that Schedule, be continued until the thirty-first day of March, nineteen hundred and twenty-five, and shall then expire, unless further continued. 10(4s) Any unrepealed enactments amending or affecting the enactments continued by this Act shall, in so far as they are temporary in their duration, be continued in like manner, whether they are mentioned in the Schedule to this Act or not. 15Short title 2. (1) This Act may be cited as the Expiringand applica- j^ws Continuance Act, 1923.tion toIreland. (2) This Act. shall apply to Northern Ireland inso far as it deals with any enactment relating to a subject with respect to which the Parliament of Northern 20 Ireland has not power to make laws, but subject to this provision this Act shall not apply to Ireland. 13 &.11 Gi:o. 5.1 Expiring Laioii' Continuance.schedul e.Pakt I.Ses3icm and Chapter.Short Title.How far continued.Amending Acts.0)46 & 47 Viet, o. 60..101520253035(2)58 & 59 Viet, c. 21.-10(324Edw. 7.0.2481The Labourers (Ire-land) Act, 1883.The Seal Fisheries (North Pacific) Act, 1895.The Wireless Tele-graphy Act, 1904.The whole act the whole Act.The whole Act.48 & 49 Viet.c. 77. 49 & 50 Viet.c 59 54 & 55 Viet.c. 48. 54 & 55 Viet.c.7l. 55 & 56 Viet.c. 7. 59 & 60 Viet.c. 53. 61 & 62 Viet.c. 37. 3 Edw. 7.c. 37. 6 Edw.c. 37. 7 Edw. - c. 44. 9 Edw.c. 42. 1 & 2 Geo. 5.c. 19. 4 & 5 Geo. 5.c. 32. 8 & 9 Geo. 5.c. 20. 9&10Geo.5.A 2 4 JJJccpiring Laws Continuance.
